intro: Gilia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Mirbelie family (Loasaceae) and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branching stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Gilia pulchella is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it blooms in late spring to early summer.
